question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Let $a,$ $b,$ $c,$ $p,$ $q,$ and $r$ be real numbers such that
\[ egin{vmatrix} p & b & c \ a & q & c \ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]Assuming that $a 
eq p,$ $b 
eq q,$ and $c 
eq r,$ find the value of $ rac{p}{p - a} +  rac{q}{q - b} +  rac{r}{r - c}.$
inference:
We have 
\[\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]

Since $a \neq p$, we have 
\[\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ 0 & q - b & c - a \\ 0 & b & r - a \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]

Expanding along the first row, we get
\[p \begin{vmatrix} q - b & c - a \\ b & r - a \end{vmatrix} - b \begin{vmatrix} 0 & c - a \\ 0 & r - a \end{vmatrix} + c \begin{vmatrix} 0 & q - b \\ 0 & b \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]

Simplifying, we get
\[p(q - b)(r - a) = 0.\]

Since $p \neq 0$, $q \neq b$, and $a \neq r$, we have $p - a = 0$, $q - b = 0$, and $r - c = 0$.

Therefore,
\[\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} = \frac{p}{0} + \frac{q}{0} + \frac{r}{0}.\]

Since the denominator is $0$, the expression is undefined.

Final Answer: \\boxed{undefined}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Expanding the determinant, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} &= p \begin{vmatrix} q & c \\ b & r \end{vmatrix} - b \begin{vmatrix} a & c \\ a & r \end{vmatrix} + c \begin{vmatrix} a & q \\ a & b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= p(qr - bc) - b(ar - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\
&= pqr - bpc - abr + abc + abc - acq \\
&= 2abc - abr - acq - bcp + pqr.
\end{align*}Let $x = p - a,$ $y = q - b,$ and $z = r - c.$  Then $p = a + x,$ $q = b + y,$ and $r = c + z.$  Substituting, we get
\[2abc - ab(c + z) - ac(b + y) - bc(a + x) + (a + x)(b + y)(c + z) = 0.\]This simplifies to $ayz + bxz + cxy + xyz = 0.$

Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= \frac{a + x}{x} + \frac{b + y}{y} + \frac{c + z}{z} \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + 1 + \frac{b}{y} + 1 + \frac{c}{z} + 1 \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + \frac{b}{y} + \frac{c}{z} + 3 \\
&= \frac{ayz + bxz + cxy}{xyz} +  3 \\
&= \frac{-xyz}{xyz} + 3 = \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}

Since $a \neq p$, we have 
\[\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ 0 & q - b & c - a \\ 0 & b & r - a \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]

Simplifying, we get
\[p(q - b)(r - a) = 0.\]

Since $p \neq 0$, $q \neq b$, and $a \neq r$, we have $p - a = 0$, $q - b = 0$, and $r - c = 0$.

Therefore,
\[\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} = \frac{p}{0} + \frac{q}{0} + \frac{r}{0}.\]

Since the denominator is $0$, the expression is undefined.

ground_truth:
Expanding the determinant, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} &= p \begin{vmatrix} q & c \\ b & r \end{vmatrix} - b \begin{vmatrix} a & c \\ a & r \end{vmatrix} + c \begin{vmatrix} a & q \\ a & b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= p(qr - bc) - b(ar - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\
&= pqr - bpc - abr + abc + abc - acq \\
&= 2abc - abr - acq - bcp + pqr.
\end{align*}Let $x = p - a,$ $y = q - b,$ and $z = r - c.$  Then $p = a + x,$ $q = b + y,$ and $r = c + z.$  Substituting, we get
\[2abc - ab(c + z) - ac(b + y) - bc(a + x) + (a + x)(b + y)(c + z) = 0.\]This simplifies to $ayz + bxz + cxy + xyz = 0.$

Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= \frac{a + x}{x} + \frac{b + y}{y} + \frac{c + z}{z} \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + 1 + \frac{b}{y} + 1 + \frac{c}{z} + 1 \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + \frac{b}{y} + \frac{c}{z} + 3 \\
&= \frac{ayz + bxz + cxy}{xyz} +  3 \\
&= \frac{-xyz}{xyz} + 3 = \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}
